title: On the equations defining the Ricci-flows of manifolds

title_detail.value: On the equations defining the Ricci-flows of manifolds

summary:
The examples of the Ricci flows on four-dimendionsl manifolds which are
determined by help of nonlinear differentials equations of the type of
Monge-Ampere are constructed. Their particular solutions and their properties
are discussed.

summary_detail.value:
The examples of the Ricci flows on four-dimendionsl manifolds which are
determined by help of nonlinear differentials equations of the type of
Monge-Ampere are constructed. Their particular solutions and their properties
are discussed.

author: Valerii Dryuma
fulltext:
arXiv:1111.3876v1 [physics.gen-ph] 2 Nov 2011

On equations defining the Ricci flows of manifolds
Valerii Dryuma∗
Institute of Mathematics and Informatics, AS RM,
5 Academiei Street, 2028 Kishinev, Moldova,
e-mail: valery@dryuma.com; valdryum@gmail.com

Abstract
The examples of the Ricci flows of the four-dimensional manifolds which are determined
by help of nonlinear differential equations of the type of Monge-Ampere are constructed.Their
particular solutions are derived and their properties are discussed.

4D model of the Ricci-flow

1

We study the system of equations
∂

(2)

In this case the Ricci-tensor of the metric (1) has a five components
Ruu , Ruv , Rvv , Rux , Rvx .

Finite-dimensional reduction

After the substitutions
A(x, y, t) = A0 (t) + A1 (t)x + A2 (t)y + A3 (t)x2 + A4 (t)yx + A5 (t)y 2 ,
B(x, y, t) = B0 (t) + B1 (t)x + B2 (t)y + B3 (t)x2 + B4 (t)xy + B5 (t)y 2 ,
C(x, y, t) = C0 (t) + C1 (t)x + C2 (t)y + C3 (t)x2 + C4 (t)xy + C5 (t)y 2,
B4 (t) = −2 A3 (t), A4 (t) = −2 B5 (t), C4 (t) = −2 B3 (t), C5 (t) = A3 (t)
